line-7: 🌟 Join Our Team at Network Rail! 🌟  Are you ready to make a difference in people's lives? At Network Rail, we connect passengers and freight customers, ensuring safe and efficient transportation across the country.   We're dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive organisation that reflects the passengers we serve. To achieve this, we're committed to becoming an open, diverse, and inclusive workplace, leveraging the skills and expertise of our talented workforce. Together, we strive to create a safe and accessible railway for everyone.   Investing in our people is key to enhancing the safety, reliability, and efficiency of our railway system. If you're passionate about making a meaningful impact, then this opportunity is for you!     About the function  System operator operates the invisible system that keeps rail passengers and freight flowing seamlessly and makes the network operate as one.  Network Operations considers how we run the railway as a system, one that�s interconnected and flowing, also safe and resilient. We support the regions and route to perform at their best.
line-9: Who are we looking for?   We are looking for an experienced Project Manager who will be able to manage the development and delivery of operational data and business improvement projects to agreed scope, time, cost, and quality requirements, whilst working with Function Directors, Executive Sponsors, Route Clients and their representatives.
line-11: What does the average day look like?  In this role, you will be agreeing remit and success criteria of operational data and business transformation projects with the relevant Executive Sponsors and Functional Directors whilst ensuring company processes and procedures are met. This will involve, managing the programme controls, periodic reporting, supporting funding applications, acting as project sponsor, applying agile project management principles, and establishing and managing collaborative cross-functional virtual teams, in a railway operations environment.  In addition to the above, you will part of a team promoting to key stakeholders the benefits of our vision to create the culture of data led operational effectiveness and continuous service improvement.  This will enable control staff, engineering, train and freight operators to work better together. This will improve safety, remove inefficiencies, and reduce cost across multiple future control periods. In doing so, it will drive real improvements for our future passengers and freight customers.
